decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this consent.
To comply with the requirements of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

Written notification of the intended start of works on site shall be sent to English Heritage, London Region (23 Saville Row, London W1X 1AB), with a copy sent to the Local Planning Authority, at least seven days before the works hereby approved are commenced.

In order that English Heritage and the Local Planning Authority may be given the opportunity of monitoring the progress of works on site to ensure the preservation of the special interest of the building affected by the works hereby approved.

Written notification of the intended start of works on site shall be sent to English Heritage, London Region (23 Saville Row, London W1X 1AB), with a copy sent to the Local Planning Authority, at least seven days before the works hereby approved are commenced.

In order that English Heritage and the Local Planning Authority may be given the opportunity of monitoring the progress of works on site to ensure the preservation of the special interest of the building affected by the works hereby approved, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC67.

All new work and works of making good to the retained fabric whether internal or external shall be finished to match the existing original work with regard to the methods used and to material, colour, texture and profile.
To preserve the character and appearance of the Listed Building and its setting, and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC67.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC61, DC67 and the guidance contained within the NPPF.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
description: Listed Building Consent to strip roof of reception building, install a breather membrane, replace the tile battens and then re-fit the tiles like for like re-using tiles where possible patching with reclaimed where not.
